title: Bachelorette Angie Kent speaks about her struggle with bulimia and its impact on her health
text:
Bachelorette star Angie Kent is using her fame to raise awareness about an important issue - bulimia.

In an interview with Now To Love, the reality TV star, 29, revealed she now suffers from two health condition as a result of 'starving herself for years'.

'I have coeliac disease and endometriosis which I think is from having really bad bulimia and starving myself for years,' she told the publication.

'I was starving myself for years': Bachelorette Angie Kent has spoken candidly about her battle with bulimia and has revealed she's now suffering from two terrible health conditions as a result of it

The blonde beauty explained her battle with the eating disorder stemmed from anxiety issues.

'People think you're doing it for attention or, they think you can snap out of it,' she said.

'Most of it [bulimia] doesn't even come from wanting to be skinny. It can be like, you have really bad skin, or you become obsessed with something because it's going to be good for your body, and then you get so obsessed you don't eat anything else.'

Angie even went as far as comparing bulimia to a drug or alcohol addiction.

'People think you're doing it for attention': The blonde beauty explained her battle with the eating disorder stemmed from anxiety issues

Meanwhile, the Gogglebox favourite recently refuted claims she had plastic surgery.

'I've had the same work for the last four years, but all of a sudden everyone is saying I've changed my face for the show,' she told NW magazine.

'That's 100 per cent not true. I've just lost weight, no extra work.'

Changing face? Meanwhile, the Gogglebox favourite recently refuted claims she had plastic surgery. 'I've had the same work for the last four years, but all of a sudden everyone is saying I've changed my face for the show,' she told NW magazine

But Angie has admitted to getting Botox and cheek filler for several years.

She told The Daily Telegraph on Wednesday: 'They say it is preventive. I just love it… just a little bit. You don't need it often, maybe once every year.'

The Bachelorette continues Thursday on Channel 10 at 7.30pm
description: Bachelorette Angie Kent has spoken about her battle with bulimia.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
